Author: ca333#0118
Content:
yes @KomodoWorld - that is correct.. our team has been working on 'automagic' migration tools. Here is a little teaser on how this would look for a BTC protocol based coin that would migrate over to KMD:

```
a) run a snapshot on height X (which gets announced as snapshot-height)
b) create new AC chain with coin-cap of a)
c) run a bunch of sendtomany to distribute the coins according to a)
d) ensure the users can access their tokens with their old privkey - so might have to provide a simple tool to calc KMD WIF out of snapshotchain (origin) WIF 
```

Author: ca333#0118
Content: thanks to various supporters and devs the above steps are all automated and a matter of executing a script.

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
the problems of MM1 were resolved in MM2 - its a very solid/stable piece of p2p/blockchain software. i have actively tested/debugged it and am amazed by its efficiency. not does it only come with native mobile support but also as a standalone enduser product. so each node does cover the full functionality scope. Furthermore does MM2 utilize state of the art p2p network/cryptographic technology: libtorrent/DHT network acts as the offchain layer (ordermatching, orderbooks, net commz, etc.). 

We recently hired a fulltime mobile dev who is currently working on a MM2 mobile GUI app.
